intro: Amauropelta piedrensis var. heterotricha, commonly known as the heterotrichous amauropelta, is a rare fern species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Pterobryaceae and is characterized by its unique frond morphology. The plant exhibits a heterotrichous growth pattern, meaning it has two distinct types of fronds on the same plant. Its leaves are typically elongated and possess a distinctive, intricate venation system. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
